chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyson S Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail, CONSECUTIVE to the 30 days.

Straight Time.
AMENDED 11-24-2015:  Apply 43 days sentence credit.

Concurrent with: Count 3.

Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 43 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Court costs, DNA surcharge and Blood Draw fee are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.  (Costs, surcharges, fees and fine can be taken out of prison of wages).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of Extended Supervision.

Case 15CT1372 is dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tyson S Olson in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 2 & 3.
Counts 1, 4 & 5 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  Count 3.

Costs:  $243
To be paid FORTHWITH - In Lieu of Payment defendant to serve an Additional 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive to the 30 Days.




Count 3:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 2.
43 Days Credit.

36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department);
FINE:  $1,569
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of The Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages).

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Jorge R Fragoso by Atty. Joseph Smith in court, defendant Tyson S Olson not in court, in custody.  
Atty. Smith waived the defendant's appearance.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

BAIL AMENDED TO $4,950 TO ALLOW TRUSTEE STATUS.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Tyson S Olson in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole Masnica on behalf of Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense requests bail motion.  State does not object.  Bail amended to allow trustee status in the jail.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
